intro: Tragia cearensis, commonly known as the Brazilian burr or Ceará burr, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its spiny, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are dry, indehiscent capsules that enclose numerous seeds, often covered in short, hooked hairs. Tragia cearensis is often found in disturbed habitats and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
